profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-10-03 16:38:46 -0700.

did.abstract: Lester Breslow was a former dean of the UCLA School of Public Health, professor emeritus of health services, and one of the leading figures in public health. He was born March 17, 1915 in Bismarck, ND, and received a BS in Psychology (1935) from the University of Minnesota, where he also earned his medical and public health degrees (MD, 1938; MPH, 1941). He is widely known for his early advocacy and research into health promotion and disease prevention. This collection consists of materials related to Breslow's professional research, scholarship, and leadership in the field of public health both as a UCLA professor and as a researcher and advocate in non-UCLA affiliated projects. The papers include professional correspondence, research notes and files, authored reports and related materials, conference presentation and talks, legislative testimonies and related materials.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright to portions of this collection has been assigned to the UCLA Library Special Collections. The library can grant permission to publish for materials to which it holds the copyright. All requests for permission to publish must be submitted in writing to Library Special Collections. Credit shall be given as follows: The Regents of the University of California on behalf of the UCLA Library Special Collections.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: COLLECTION CONTAINS DIGITAL MATERIALS: This collection contains processed digital materials. Special equipment or further processing may be required for viewing. All requests to access digital materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Preliminary processing by Charlotte B. Brown. Processed by Angel Diaz, 2018.
Collection includes one unprocessed CD and one unprocessed DVD.

Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Lester Breslow was a former dean of the UCLA School of Public Health, professor emeritus of health services, and one of the leading figures in public health. He was born March 17, 1915 in Bismarck, ND, and received a BS in Psychology (1935) from the University of Minnesota, where he also earned his medical and public health degrees (MD, 1938; MPH, 1941).

After serving as a US Army captain in the Pacific Division during World War II, Breslow went on to the California Department of Public Health, first as Chief of the Bureau of Chronic Diseases (1946-1960), then Chief of the Division of Preventive Medical Services (1960-1965), and then Director of Public Health (1965-1968). Breslow is widely known for his early advocacy and research into health promotion and disease prevention. Through pioneering studies relying on the Alameda County Human Population Laboratory beginning in the early 1960s, he helped to identify the important influence of behavior on disability and premature death. His research was among the first to show that simple health practices, such as getting regular exercise and sleep, not drinking excessively, not smoking, and maintaining a healthy weight, supports longer and better quality of life.

Breslow joined the UCLA School of Public Health faculty in 1968, serving as Dean of the School of Public Health from 1972-1980, and continued speaking and writing as professor emeritus well into his 90s. He served on numerous local, state, national, and international associations and commissions. He served as president of the International Epidemiological Association (1967-1968), the American Public Health Association (1968-1969), and the American Schools of Public Health (1973-1975). Breslow passed away in Los Angeles on April 9, 2012.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of materials related to the professional research, scholarship, and leadership in the field of public health of American physician Lester Breslow, a UCLA professor and dean of the School of Public Health. His research interests were health promotion, disease prevention, and public health programs. The papers include professional correspondence, research notes and files, authored reports and related materials, conference presentations and talks, legislative testimonies and related materials. This collection also includes administrative materials such as correspondence, memos, agendas, and reports related to Breslow's work at the UCLA School of Public health, as well as his extensive involvement with local, state, and national committees and commissions.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p:
This collection has been arranged in the following series:
Series 1: Teaching and university affairs, 1938-2009
Series 2: Research scholarship, 1932-2008
Subseries 2.1: Resource files, 1932-2005
Subseries 2.2: Grants and research, 1958-2006
Subseries 2.3: Publications and reports, 1949-2008
Subseries 2.4: Conference presentations and talks, 1955-2007
Series 3: Non-university work, 1950-2009
Subseries 3.1: Committees and consulting, 1971-2009
Subseries 3.2: Legislation and testimonies, 1950-2003
Materials are organized alphabetically, with the exception Subseries 2.3. Materials in Subseries 2.3 are organized chronologically.

controlaccess.corpname: University of California, Los Angeles. School of Public Health. Faculty -- Archives

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series is composed of professional correspondence and materials related to Breslow's occupation as faculty member and dean of the UCLA School of Public Health (SPH), including biographical materials, administrative and planning documents, memos, and reports. The correspondence is largely between Breslow and colleagues at UCLA, other universities, and local and national agencies. Breslow was involved in the establishment of public health education programs throughout the UC system, as well as evaluation and development of UC employee health advocacy and medical plans.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of materials related to the research and scholarship conducted by Breslow. His research interests were health promotion, disease prevention, and public health programs. Materials include correspondence, research notes and files, authored reports and related materials, conference presentations and talks.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: SERIES CONTAINS DIGITAL MATERIALS: Special equipment or further processing may be required for viewing. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries consists of Breslow's subject files related to his research, as well as materials related to his personal life. This includes correspondence, data sets, reports, meeting minutes and agendas, materials related to the Academic Senate, faculty interviews, and lectures. Topics include AIDS, air pollution, health care issues in California, cancer, public health legislation, pre-paid health plans, anti-smoking campaigns, correspondence with public health administrator David Satcher, and tobacco.

did.unittitle: Bulletin of the International Corresponding Club
Center for Health Enhancement Education and Research
E.I. Dupont de Nemours and Co.

Incorporation of preventive medical services into national health services

Responses to "Challenges" listed in community-based cancer program
Santa Barbara County health care service
US health care reform and public health

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains materials related to grants and funding for Breslow's research projects. This includes correspondence, reports, applications, meeting minutes, and planning and program documents. Areas of research or funders include the American Cancer Society's California division, public health improvement projects, children's health care, the Kaiser Family Foundation, community cancer control in Los Angeles, Medi-Cal programs, national health insurance, cancer and related health risks, and the Human Population Laboratory (HPL). HPL was a landmark study conducted in Alameda County by Breslow which looked at the correlation between lifestyle factors such as exercise, smoking, and sleep and a person's lifespan.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries covers reports and other publications authored or co-authored by Breslow. Materials include correspondence, notes, and reports. Topics addressed in this subseries include cancer and health care, epidemiology, health education, mammography, follow-up for the San Mateo nutrition study, and links between smoking, chronic diseases and cancer.

did.unittitle: Measuring health in the third era
Seven-year follow-up of the San Mateo nutrition study population

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains materials related to conferences Breslow attended and talks he gave. Topics include children's health care, health care provision in California, environmentally influenced disease, the role of health workers, epidemiology, the Human Population Laboratory, and the National Conference on Preventative Medicine. Box 94 includes one DVD that contains a lecture by Breslow.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This subseries has been organized in chronological order.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: SUBSERIES CONTAINS DIGITAL MATERIALS: Special equipment or further processing may be required for viewing. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series covers Breslow's work that was not related to his teaching position at UCLA. This includes committees he sat on, consulting work, legislation he worked on, and testimonies he provided for court cases. Topics include tobacco, Los Angeles County health services, the Little Hoover Commission, reports for the California legislature, and health care costs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries consists of materials related to Breslow's participation in local, state, and national committees and commissions, as well as consulting services he provided. His involvement varied from chair to reviewer, and prominent committees he served on include the Asbestiform Fibers Committee, the Armed Forces Epidemiological Board, the Governor's Committee on Health Care Costs, the Institute of Medicine, National Cancer Institute, and the President's Commission on the Health Needs of the Nation.

did.unittitle: American Cancer Society California Division Task Force
Citizens for the treatment of high blood pressure
Governor's committee on health care costs
Los Angeles County health services and public health
U.S. National Committee on Vital and Health Statistics

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains materials related to court cases Breslow testified for or legislation he supported. Materials include correspondence, reports, meeting minutes, and other documents regarding state and national legislation. Topics include health care costs at the state level, the Child Health Assurance Act, health care workers, public health recodification, and support and funding for health services and research.

did.unittitle: Association of Schools of Public Health
California Assembly on health care costs
Senate subcommittee on health and scientific research
